- I've wanted to talk
about self care for awhile.

3.35.text: Because I feel like it's something

6.16.text: that people need to talk about more.

8.16.text: In our lives we are taught to know things

11.04.text: and how to look after ourselves

20.51.text: The idea of self love is one that's

23.67.text:
painfully absent from
most people's education

26.64.text:
or their really, their
experiences of life at all.

29.80.text: I think a lot people at this point

31.89.text:
and I do wanna talk about
that some other time.

34.84.text: But honestly I feel like we could do with

36.79.text:
moving away from the idea
of tying people's value

41.51.text: to their physical attractiveness at all.

44.99.text: I think, that doesn't mean you can't care

47.40.text: about how you look I think that's great.

49.26.text:
And if you are comfortable
with how you look physically

52.16.text:
it's so much easier to be
comfortable with yourself

56.23.text: But being comfortable in your appearance

57.83.text: is not the beginning and end of being

61.38.text:
It's not easy to allow
yourself the space and time

64.73.text: to do the things that matter to you

66.75.text: without feeling guilty about being useless

70.67.text:
I mean there's this
idea that we have to be

74.34.text:
And it comes from this whole
capitalistic idea that you,

77.50.text:
your value is tied up
with what you produce

83.39.text:
rather than your inherent
value as being you.

86.97.text:
And that can be such a
harmful, tiring idea.

90.48.text:
Only you allow yourself
to see that you have value

92.45.text:
even when you're producing
nothing of use to other people,

96.42.text: I think it's when it's easiest to produce

98.74.text: the things that have value for you.

101.83.text: Equally, we're taught to forgive people

105.57.text: and we're taught to be tolerant

107.45.text: and we're taught to be respectful

111.12.text: And those are all really great things,

114.02.text:
But if you allow that to
mean that there are people

118.13.text: in your life that harm you and upset you

120.34.text: and just have this like toxic influence

126.75.text:
then you need to remove
those people from your life

129.05.text:
and allow yourself to do
it and not feel guilt.

133.22.text: There's so much else I could say about it.

135.11.text: I mean Stephen Fry has that great quote

137.50.text:
about understanding your
mood and your emotions

140.24.text:
like the weather, you
can't always control them

144.32.text: you need to accept them sometimes,

147.90.text: If it's raining, you put up an umbrella.

149.69.text: You need to have that sort of relationship

151.66.text:
with your own moods that
you are aware of them,

154.15.text:
you're adapting, but
you don't blame yourself

159.25.text: And I think that's kinda of

161.04.text: the core of what I'm saying here.

162.25.text:
You need to be able to
accept yourself as you are.

166.24.text: And accept the things that you need

167.80.text:
and the things that you
love without constantly

170.63.text:
blaming and guilt tripping
yourself about it.

175.39.text: I mean other than that, what can you say?

177.69.text: Drink lots of water, eat green vegetables.

184.53.text: Even if it's just out onto the road

186.74.text: and look up at the sky.

189.29.text:
Don't pee quickly, no one
thinks you're knitting in there.

192.47.text: Be able to laugh at yourself.

196.30.text: that'll get you through a lot.

199.46.text:
'Cause things aren't
always funny at the time,

201.34.text: but if you find the ability to laugh

203.27.text: at all the stupid things you've done.

205.94.text: And laugh at yourself as a person.

208.26.text:
Just, you know, don't take
yourself too seriously.

212.35.text:
It can free you a lot, the
ability to find yourself funny.

216.11.text:
You know, do not mental
laugh at your own jokes,

218.22.text:
but you know what, screw
that, laugh at your own jokes.

226.23.text:
Toot your own horn,
tell people when you're

234.55.text:
You deserve to be happy,
you deserve to be loved

239.89.text: And those are easy things to say.

243.30.text:
And they're not easy things
to believe about yourself.

252.10.text: I'd tell you fake it til you make it

258.32.text: You don't need to all the time.

261.67.text: I think pretending you have confidence

263.27.text: can help you get there eventually,

268.40.text: if you don't feel great about yourself,

269.68.text: you don't need to pretend you do.

272.14.text:
Again, you have every
right to feel how you feel.
